item.title: Udev Device Mapping for Daily Tasks
item.description: Does USB device should always have specific access rights? Or network cards must have specific names? For such questions, and even more, Linux has a standard tool in its arsenal – UDEV. UDEV is a userspace system that allows you to identify devices based on their properties, and register userspace handlers. Set persistent name for device. The task is to make persistent drive name. To do this, you need to create a new UDEV rule.
